metadata.title: CVE-2020-15659 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 78 and Firefox ESR 78.0. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 79, Firefox ESR < 68.11, Firefox ESR <78.1, Thunderbird < 68.11, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
